history.content:
You should take 61B for sure. One typically can't begin taking upper division courses without at least 61B completed, and you should consider taking 61C straight afterward, as many software/architecture/hardware-related upper divs require it. As for EE16-, I'm not sure of your situation with respect to skipping 16A, typically you'd need to have completed Math 54 and also have taken EECS 47D in order to skip out of 16A. Unless you have done these, you should take 16A. 

Consult this guide for prerequisites/suggestions for future courses: https://hkn.eecs.berkeley.edu/courseguides

children.subject: I'm not sure what the policies are on transferring 61B credit as P/NP and then retaking it, but many students retake 61B after taking an equivalent in community college just because 61B is one of the best and most important courses at Berkeley EECS. You may want to read past posts on this piazza about that. Otherwise you should be fine, I know students who took 61C, 61B and EE16A/B concurrently and they were okay (though keep in mind it is a very heavy workload since all of these courses have labs and 61B and 61C have rather lengthy projects). You may want to consider taking 61B and then 61C in another semester with some upper div. course, as this is what I think students typically do. But, you know your own schedule best and will have to figure that out yourself. Hope it helps

I will probably pass/no pass cs61B(because I have taken data structures in community college and it articulates ) if I do good in 70 and 61A ,its not going to harm me right? And if I take it pass/ no pass can I then take 61C ,ee16a and cs61B concurrently
Are you familiar with the HKN course guide, too? that might help you see the prereqs for courses.https://hkn.eecs.berkeley.edu/courseguides

history.content:
Hi, 

  In am taking cs61a ,cs70 ,and one class for American cultures. What classes should I take next semester ? 61B ,EE16B/ee16a(I might skip ee16a) and what other classes can I take? Should I take a upper div class if I get good grades in these classes .

                                 Thank you!!
